00028 #include <string.h>                                              // for size_t
00029 #include "hal.h"
00030 
00031 #include <winsock2.h>                       // for WindSock network facilities
00032 #include <stdio.h>
00033 #include <conio.h>
00034 
00035 //............................................................................
00036 SOCKET l_serverSock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00037 SOCKET l_clentSock  = INVALID_SOCKET;
00038 
00039 //............................................................................
00040 bool tcpOpen(int portNum) {
00041 
00042     // initialize Windows sockets
00043     static WSADATA wsaData;
00044     int wsaErr = WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(2,0), &wsaData);
00045     if (wsaErr == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00046         printf("Windows Sockets cannot be initialized.\n"
00047                "The library reported error 0x%08X.", wsaErr);
00048         return false;
00049     }
00050 
00051     l_serverSock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP);    // TCP socket
00052     if (l_serverSock == INVALID_SOCKET){
00053         printf("Server socket cannot be created.\n"
00054                "Windows socket error 0x%08X.",
00055                WSAGetLastError());
00056         return false;
00057     }
00058 
00059     struct sockaddr_in local;
00060     memset(&local, 0, sizeof(local));
00061     local.sin_family = AF_INET;
00062     local.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
00063     local.sin_port = htons((unsigned short)portNum);
00064 
00065     // bind() associates a local address and port combination with the
00066     // socket just created. This is most useful when the application is a
00067     // server that has a well-known port that clients know about in advance.
00068     if (bind(l_serverSock, (struct sockaddr *)&local, sizeof(local))
00069         == SOCKET_ERROR)
00070     {
00071         printf("Error by binding server socket.\n");
00072         return false;
00073     }
00074 
00075     if (listen(l_serverSock, 1) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00076         printf("Server socket listen failed.\n"
00077                "Windows socket error 0x%08X.",
00078                WSAGetLastError());
00079         return false;
00080     }
00081     /*
00082     // Set the socket to non-blocking mode.
00083     ULONG ioctl_opt = 1;
00084     if (ioctlsocket(l_serverSock, FIONBIO, &ioctl_opt) == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00085         printf("Socket configuration failed.\n"
00086                "Windows socket error 0x%08X.",
00087                WSAGetLastError());
00088         return false;
00089     }
00090     */
00091     return true;                                                    // success
00092 }
00093 //............................................................................
00094 void tcpClose(void) {
00095     if (l_serverSock != INVALID_SOCKET) {
00096         closesocket(l_serverSock);
00097     }
00098     WSACleanup();
00099 }
00100 //............................................................................
00101 int tcpRead(unsigned char *buf, size_t size) {
00102     int n;
00103 
00104     if (l_clentSock == INVALID_SOCKET) {      // still waiting for the client?
00105         n = 0;                                      // no data from the client
00106         if (_kbhit()) {
00107             return -1;                                            // terminate
00108         }
00109 
00110         fd_set readSet;
00111         FD_ZERO(&readSet);
00112         FD_SET(l_serverSock, &readSet);
00113 
00114         struct timeval delay;
00115         delay.tv_sec = 0;
00116         delay.tv_usec = 200000;
00117 
00118         int nfound = ::select(0, &readSet, 0, 0, &delay);
00119         if (nfound == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00120             printf("Server socket select failed.\n"
00121                    "Windows socket error 0x%08X.",
00122                    WSAGetLastError());
00123             return -1;                                            // terminate
00124         }
00125 
00126         if (FD_ISSET(l_serverSock, &readSet)) {
00127             struct sockaddr_in fromAddr;
00128             int fromLen = (int)sizeof(fromAddr);
00129             l_clentSock = accept(l_serverSock,
00130                                  (struct sockaddr *)&fromAddr, &fromLen);
00131             if (l_clentSock == INVALID_SOCKET) {
00132                 printf("Server socket accept failed.\n"
00133                        "Windows socket error 0x%08X.",
00134                        WSAGetLastError());
00135                 return -1;                                        // terminate
00136             }
00137             printf("Accepted connection from %s, port %d\n",
00138                    inet_ntoa(fromAddr.sin_addr),
00139                    htons(fromAddr.sin_port));
00140         }
00141     }
00142     else {
00143         fd_set readSet;
00144         FD_ZERO(&readSet);
00145         FD_SET(l_clentSock, &readSet);
00146 
00147         int nfound = ::select(0, &readSet, 0, 0, 0);     // selective blocking
00148         if (nfound == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00149             printf("Client socket select failed.\n"
00150                    "Windows socket error 0x%08X.",
00151                    WSAGetLastError());
00152             return -1;                                            // terminate
00153         }
00154         if (FD_ISSET(l_clentSock, &readSet)) {
00155             n = recv(l_clentSock, (char *)buf, size, 0);
00156             if (n == SOCKET_ERROR) {
00157                 printf("Client socket error.\n"
00158                        "Windows socket error 0x%08X.",
00159                        WSAGetLastError());
00160             }
00161             if (n <= 0) {                                // the client hang up
00162                 closesocket(l_clentSock);
00163 
00164                 // go back to waiting for a client, or a keypress to terminate
00165                 l_clentSock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00166                 return 0;                               // no data from client
00167             }
00168         }
00169         else {
00170             n = 0;                                  // no data from the client
00171         }
00172     }
00173 
00174     return (int)n;
00175 }
